contentrichtext.text: {{About|the city in Chelyabinsk Oblast called "Ugolnye Kopi" until 1928|the urban-type settlement in Chukotka Autonomous Okrug|Ugolnye Kopi}} {{Infobox Russian city |en_name=Kopeysk |ru_name=Копейск |image_skyline= |image_caption= |latd=55 |latm=06 |lats |longd=61 |longm=37 |longs |map_label_position=left |image_coa=Coat of Arms of Kopeysk (Chelyabinsk oblast) (2002).png |coa_caption= |image_flag= |flag_caption= |anthem= |anthem_ref= |holiday= |holiday_ref= |federal_subject=[[Chelyabinsk Oblast]] |federal_subject_ref= |adm_data_as_of=September 2011 |adm_city_jur=[[City of federal subject significance|City]] of Kopeysk |adm_city_jur_ref=<ref name="Ref30" /> |adm_ctr_of=City of Kopeysk |adm_ctr_of_ref=<ref name="Ref30" /> |inhabloc_cat=City |inhabloc_cat_ref= |inhabloc_type= |inhabloc_type_ref= |mun_data_as_of=September 2011 |urban_okrug_jur=Kopeysky Urban Okrug |urban_okrug_jur_ref=<ref name="Ref30" /> |mun_admctr_of=Kopeysky Urban Okrug |mun_admctr_of_ref=<ref name="Ref30" /> |leader_title= |leader_title_ref= |leader_name= |leader_name_ref= |representative_body= |representative_body_ref= |area_of_what= |area_as_of= |area_km2= |area_km2_ref= |pop_2010census=137601 |pop_2010census_rank=123rd |pop_2010census_ref=<ref name="2010Census">{{ru-pop-ref|2010Census}}</ref> |pop_density= |pop_density_as_of= |pop_density_ref= |pop_latest= |pop_latest_date= |pop_latest_ref= |established_date= |established_title= |established_date_ref= |current_cat_date= |current_cat_date_ref= |prev_name1= |prev_name1_date= |prev_name1_ref= |postal_codes= |postal_codes_ref= |dialing_codes= |dialing_codes_ref= |website= |website_ref= |commonscat= |date=February 2012 }} '''Kopeysk''' ({{lang-ru|Копе́йск}}) is a [[types of inhabited localities in Russia|city]] in [[Chelyabinsk Oblast]], [[Russia]], located southeast of [[Chelyabinsk]]. Population: {{ru-census|p2010=137,601|p2002=73,342|p1989=79,048}} The population growth between 2002 and 2010 was caused by the annexation of surrounding settlements. ==History== Prior to 1928, this city was called '''Ugolnye Kopi''', meaning ''coal mines'' (hence the pick on the city's coat of arms). The element "Ugolnye" was removed and the suffix "-sk" was added to indicate the locative.<ref>[http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/322038/Kopeysk Encyclopædia Britannica]</ref> ==Administrative and municipal status== Within the [[subdivisions of Russia#Administrative divisions|framework of administrative divisions]], it is, together with three [[types of inhabited localities in Russia|rural localities]], incorporated as the '''[[City of federal subject significance|City]] of Kopeysk'''—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the [[administrative divisions of Chelyabinsk Oblast|districts]].<ref name="Ref30">Resolution #161</ref> As a [[subdivisions of Russia#Municipal divisions|municipal division]], the City of Kopeysk is incorporated as '''Kopeysky Urban Okrug'''.<ref name="Ref30" /> ==References== ===Notes=== {{Reflist}} ===Sources=== *{{RussiaAdmMunRef|che|mun|list}} ==External links== *[http://www.kopeysk-okrug.ru/ Official website of Kopeysky Urban Okrug] {{ru icon}} *[http://kopeysk.info/ Unofficial website of Kopeysk] {{ru icon}} {{Chelyabinsk Oblast}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2011}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Chelyabinsk Oblast]]
